text:
Emiliano Mondonico (9 March 1947 – 29 March 2018) was an Italian professional footballer and coach. He played as a winger. In 1966 he was signed by Cremonese, with whom he played one season in Serie D and one season.
Mondonico began his managerial career with the Cremonese youth team in 1979. In 1981, he became manager of the senior team.
In 1990, he joined Torino, where he won the Mitropa Cup over Pisa and finished in fifth-place in the league during the 1990–91 season.
In 2012, Mondonico was fired as head coach by Novara and later retired.
Mondonico died on 29 March 2018 from stomach cancer in Milan at the age of 71.
